1. What do you notice?

We notice that the number of players that are people of colour is far greater than the number of head coaches that are people of colour. The gap is quite large in all leagues except for The Major Soccer League which is the only exception having a smaller gap. 
The National Basketball Association seems to have the most people of colour in the league while having less than half of the coaches as people of colour.

2. What do you wonder?

We wonder how they are increasing diversity in these leagues. Are they reserving more spots in the leagues for people of colour or simply supporting them more, allowing them to increase their skills and make it onto the teams?

3.  What impact does this have on you and your community?

People of colour are not promoted to coaches as much as non-people of colour.  Racism is still prevalent in society today. 

4. What is going on in this graph?

This graph compares the percentage of players of colour compared to the percentage of head coaches of colour.

Catchy Title: 
- Diversity in the lens of the public eye, not so much on the bench
- Increased diversity in professional athletes, not so much in coaching faculties
